ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Different perspectives on treating both classical and quantum noise.
The course gave a nice overview of a lot of topics relevant to any scientist that uses electronics, from stochastic variables to circuits. I most enjoyed the material on statistical mechanics.
I developed an appreciation for the background for the treatment of noise, both classically and quantum mechanically.
Linear response theory, basic information theory, fluctuation dissipation theory.
I have learned a lot about quantum noise and signal theory.
Knowledge about stochastic process, transmission line, quantum physics and fluctuation dissipation theory.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course were in the pedagogical structure of the lectures. In my opinion, the lectures moved a slow pace through at least the first half of the term. As a result, many of the interested topics that I was more interested in seemed to be rushed toward the end of the term.

Strengths: I really liked that course was entirely self-contained. The lecture notes were excellent and very helpful. Lectures were thorough and conceptually motivated. A possible improvement: I would have benefitted from more example problems with solutions in the notes.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend the course, especially to anyone in Qlab or RSL.
Definitely. It is a good introduction to measurement and any experimental physicist or electrical engineer should understand this material.
Yes. This course is extremely helpful if you work on optomechanics.
Yes, this course is a great challenge for student but the great professor makes this course interesting and quite meaningful.
Yes, this was a very unique and useful course. Prof. Devoret is extremely knowledgeable and a gifted teacher.
